title: At what height above the surface of the earth will its acceleration due to gravity decrease by 64%? - Quora

response.answer_text: g decreases to 64% of it’s value at 1,592,750 meters height, or 1,592.75 km height. I made a blueJ program to solve your question. All you have to do is put the percentage of g you want, and it can calculate the height above the surface of the earth. The program was actually beta for some other personal complex calculation I was trying to do, but when I saw your question on quora, I thought I can help you by twisting the program a bit. If you know how to use blueJ, you can use the program I have provided below to easily plug in the percentage of g and get the height. I could have made the program a little more less demanding and faster by removing the unnecessary iteration, but since the problem doesn’t need that much of computing power, I got a bit lazy and left it. It works however. import java.io.*; import java.lang.Math; public class AccelerationDueToGravity { public static void main() throws IOException { int c; for(int i=1;i>=0; i++) { double f, g, p, h=0, k=0; BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System Resources and Information.)); System.out.println("Please enter the percentage of g"); p = Double.parseDouble(br.readLine()); g = (6.67408*(Math.pow(10,-11))*5.972*(Math.pow(10,24)))/((6.371*(Math.pow(10,6))+h)*(6.371*(Math.pow(10,6))+h)); System.out.println("The acceleration due to gravity on earth's surface is "+g+" m/s^2"); f = (g/100)*p; for(h=0; h>=0; h++) { k = (6.67408*(Math.pow(10,-11))*5.972*(Math.pow(10,24)))/((6.371*(Math.pow(10,6))+h)*(6.371*(Math.pow(10,6))+h)); if (k <= f) break; } System.out.println("The height in meters is = "+h+" or in kilometers is "+(h/1000)); System.out.println("The value of g at "+h+" is = "+k); System.out.println("\n If you want to do the calculations again, press 1, else press any other number"); c = Integer.parseInt(br.readLine()); if(c==1) continue; else break; } } }
